metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9014 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Django before 1.8.x before 1.8.16, 1.9.x before 1.9.11, and 1.10.x before 1.10.3, when settings.DEBUG is True, allow remote attackers to conduct DNS rebinding attacks by leveraging failure to validate the HTTP Host header against settings.ALLOWED_HOSTS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.6.1-2ubuntu0.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-2ubuntu0.16').
